result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Werch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $200.00 cash bond be applied to the court costs, leaving a balance of $243.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court sentences the defendant to TIME SERVED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael M Werch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: FTP Hearing 10-19-2015 for $243.00
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding

ADDRESS INFO for Michael M Werch
Current: 107 Professional Plaza, Neenah, WI 54956 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2015)
Prior: N638 Cth X, Berlin, WI 54923

10:26 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will proceed to plea & sentencing.  DA recites plea agreement, 2014CF78 will plea to count 1 amended to Carrying concealed weapon as repeater in violation of 941.23(2) and will plea to count 4, 2014CF125 defendant will plea to count 1 amended to Misdemeanor BJ.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant will enter a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to amended count 1 and count 4 on 2014CF78 and amended count 1 on 2014CF125.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 on 2014CF78 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF78 (counts 1 & 4)

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Restitution $194.89
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
AODA assessment

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the restitution and court costs, and any balance be applied to 2014CF125

18 days of sentence credit if revoked.

2014CF125

TIME SERVED
court costs - $200 bond on file is to be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 10:40 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:53 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - an offer has been received and have not heard from the defendant.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:54 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

3:30 p.m.   No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson / Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received an offer and will need to talk with the defendant.  Court will set for plea & sentencing within 30 days.

Court adjourned at 3:31 p.m.
Status hearing on January 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

3:16 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Barb Privat.

2014CF78
Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

Court directs Status Hearing be held in approximately thirty days - both cases.

Court adjourned at 3:18 p.m.
Status hearing on December 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

1:38 p.m.  2014CF125 - Defendant in custody and in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, defendant requests to make a statement on his own.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by DA Christenson, requests bond remain as is.  Statement by the Court - denies the request for bond modification at this time, but if defendant can come up with a plan, court will re-visit.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is ready to waive the preliminary hearings in both of the felony cases.

Court calls 14CF78 - same appearances.

No objection by the State to waive the preliminary hearings in both felony cases 2014CF78 and 2014CF125.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim in each case and binds the defendant over for trial in each case.

State files an information on 2014CF125.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Status to be scheduled on this case and Arraignment is to be scheduled on 2014CF78 within the next 30 days.

Court adjourned at 1:47 p.m.
for Reduction of Bail
Preliminary hearing on November 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat, has not discussed the preliminary hearing.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing in 30 days.  Atty Privat is to let the DA's office know if it will be a prelim or not.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests a lower cash bond.  No objection by DA.  Court will amend to $200.00 cash bond with the same conditions as before.

for Reduction of Bail
Status hearing on November 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

2:48 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody and via video from Green Lake County Jail, with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.  

Court orders bond set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.

Attorney Privat waives the time limits as to the preliminary hearing.  Defendant qualifies for PD representation and she will be representing the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing, regarding preliminary hearing, to be held in a couple of weeks.
